column4: Hiya guys. Im still having problems with the "nvidia" driver. My screen is stuck at 800x600 resolution and 1/2 inch of my screen is black (at the right column)
what version of the nvidia-glx package did you install
what is the version of the package installed
It only gives me these numers under version:
please do dpkg -l | grep -i nvidia and tell me if the package is nvidia-glx, nvidia-glx-new or nvidia-glx-legacy
How can I enable glx on the older ones. I cant use opengl with those
is it supported on your card/driver
yes, it worked under the "nvidia" driver. My resolution was messed up but the glx worked great
did you reconfigure your display to have the correct resolution

With the legacy driver the resolution works well out of the box, its just the glx not working. With the "nvidia driver, the resolution got stuck at 800x600, I tried to modify my xorg.conf file but nothing worked.... and it confused the crt-out port of my laptop with the lcd screen.
